dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, hey B, a lot of intense back-and-forth this week, huh? Especially after all that violence we saw, uh, in Kenosha and Portland.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, hey B, a lot of intense back and forth this week, huh? Especially after all that violence we saw, uh, in Kenosha and Portland.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since violent clashes between Black Lives Matter protesters and counter-protesters in Kenosha and Portland led to three deaths last week, the Biden and Trump campaigns have repeatedly called on each other to denounce protest violence while accusing each other of supporting it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, A, it's been pretty wild. I mean, we've got both campaigns basically calling on each other to denounce protest violence, but then, like, accusing *each other* of supporting it. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, A, it's been pretty wild. I mean, we've got both campaigns basically calling on each other to denounce protest violence, but then, like, accusing each other of supporting it. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since violent clashes between Black Lives Matter protesters and counter-protesters in Kenosha and Portland led to three deaths last week, the Biden and Trump campaigns have repeatedly called on each other to denounce protest violence while accusing each other of supporting it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then Trump goes and defends his *own* supporters' actions, like, in Portland, while simultaneously hitting Biden for not being tough enough on, uh, "radical left-wing groups."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then Trump goes and defends his own supporters actions, like, in Portland, while simultaneously hitting Biden for not being tough enough on, uh, radical left-wing groups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After asserting that former Vice President Joe Biden failed to adequately denounce protest violence, President Donald Trump on Monday defended the violent actions of a caravan of his supporters in Portland, Ore... Trump campaign advisor Jason Miller hitting Biden for not specifically mentioning radical left-wing groups like Antifa in his blanket denunciation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's such a double standard. Biden comes out with a pretty stern condemnation, right? He says rioting isn't protesting, denounces violence from both the left and right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such a double standard. Biden comes out with a pretty stern condemnation, right? He says rioting isn't protesting, denounces violence from both the left and right.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden offered a stern condemnation of protest violence in his speech, declaring rioting is not protesting after unequivocally denouncing violence on the left and right and calling on Trump to do the same in a statement on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But then the Trump team immediately jumps on him. Jason Miller, you know, saying Biden didn't *specifically* mention Antifa.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But then the Trump team immediately jumps on him. Jason Miller, you know, saying Biden didn't specifically mention Antifa.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bidens remarks were met with immediate dissatisfaction from the Trump team, with Trump campaign advisor Jason Miller hitting Biden for not specifically mentioning radical left-wing groups like Antifa in his blanket denunciation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Trump echoed that sentiment, claiming Biden was repeating this "monstrous lie" about peaceful protests. But then you look at what *Trump* said about his own supporters...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Trump echoed that sentiment, claiming Biden was repeating this monstrous lie about peaceful protests. But then you look at what Trump said about his own supporters...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That sentiment was echoed by Trump, who spent much of his White House briefing taking shots at Democrats, claiming Biden didnt mention the far-left and accusing him of repeating the monstrous lie that these are peaceful protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the Portland caravan! Paintballs and tear gas, caught on video. And Trump's response? [overlaps] "Peaceful protest."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the Portland caravan! Paintballs and tear gas, caught on video. And Trump's response? Peaceful protest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But given the opportunity to denounce a caravan of his supporters in Portland, who were caught on video Saturday shooting protesters with paintballs or tear gas, Trump called it a peaceful protest and declared paint is not bullets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] "Paint is not bullets," he said! Like, come on. And then Kyle Rittenhouse in Kenosha, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Paint is not bullets, he said! Like, come on. And then Kyle Rittenhouse in Kenosha, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But given the opportunity to denounce a caravan of his supporters in Portland, who were caught on video Saturday shooting protesters with paintballs or tear gas, Trump called it a peaceful protest and declared paint is not bullets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he called that an "interesting situation" and asserted Rittenhouse was trying to get away, probably would've been killed. Without, uh, any evidence, mind you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he called that an interesting situation and asserted Rittenhouse was trying to get away, probably would've been killed. Without, uh, any evidence, mind you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Asked about Rittenhouse, Trump called it an interesting situation, and claimed Rittenhouse was trying to get away from protesters who violently attacked him, asserting, without evidence, that Rittenhouse probably would've been killed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a stark contrast to Biden's speech, where he's like, "Do I look to you like a radical socialist with a soft spot for rioters? Really?" He's pushing back hard on that narrative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a stark contrast to Biden's speech, where he's like, Do I look to you like a radical socialist with a soft spot for rioters? Really? He's pushing back hard on that narrative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ask yourself: Do I look to you like a radical socialist with a soft spot for rioters? Really? Biden asked during his speech, in contrast with Trumps claim that he would surrender to the left wing mob.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, also, his comments on law enforcement. He's, like, telling a CBS affiliate that every cop has the right to come home safe, totally contradicting Trump's "anti-police" claims.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, also, his comments on law enforcement. He's, like, telling a C B S affiliate that every cop has the right to come home safe, totally contradicting Trump's anti-police claims.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden also contradicted Trumps multiple assertions that he is anti-police, telling Pittsburgh CBS affiliate KDKA, every cop when he puts on that badge has the right to be able to come home at night and to be safe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The Biden campaign, I mean, they're not holding back either. They called Trump "too weak, too scared" to repudiate his own supporters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Biden campaign, I mean, they're not holding back either. They called Trump too weak, too scared to repudiate his own supporters.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Biden campaign released a statement calling Trump too weak, too scared, to repudiate one of his supporters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and urged him to join in saying violence is wrong, period. No matter who does it. [overlaps] And if he can't, he's unfit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and urged him to join in saying violence is wrong, period. No matter who does it. And if he can't, he's unfit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the statement, Biden urged Trump to join me in saying that while peaceful protest is a right a necessity violence is wrong, period. No matter who does it, no matter what political affiliation they have. Period, and said that, if he cant, he is unfit to be President.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Which, wow, that's a strong statement. And speaking of Kenosha, Trump's actually heading there tomorrow, despite the Wisconsin Governor urging him not to.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, wow, that's a strong statement. And speaking of Kenosha, Trump's actually heading there tomorrow, despite the Wisconsin Governor urging him not to.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump is slated to travel to Kenosha on Tuesday to survey the damage from the protests, despite Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers urging him not to.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. He says Kenosha is something "we did a good job on," referring to the National Guard. And he thinks his visit could, uh, "increase enthusiasm" or "love and respect for our country."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. He says Kenosha is something we did a good job on, referring to the National Guard. And he thinks his visit could, uh, increase enthusiasm or love and respect for our country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kenosha is something we did a good job on, Trump said, citing the national guard intervention. Should be very interesting, Trump said of the visit, predicting It could increase enthusiasm, it could increase love and respect for our country, after he was asked about concerns it could increase violence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, you have to wonder how that's going to play out on the ground, given the concerns about it potentially *increasing* violence. It's just a lot of very conflicting messages, and, like, no real leadership on de-escalation, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, you have to wonder how that's going to play out on the ground, given the concerns about it potentially increasing violence. It's just a lot of very conflicting messages, and, like, no real leadership on de-escalation, you know?
